website_summaries.verdict: The Propet TravelActiv exceeded the expectations of consumers when it came to comfort. It was considered stylish and offered adequate lateral and arch support. The buyers were also satisfied with how light, airy, and soft it was. Though many liked the roomy forefoot and the snug heel, there were complaints that it did not follow the brand’s measurement scheme. Other issues noted by users included the flimsy and uncomfortable insole and the poor quality of the shoe. But overall, those who were able to find the right size and width were pleased with their purchase.
pros: The Propet TravelActiv was described as an extremely comfortable pair of walking shoes for long periods of wear by a vast majority of owners
The fit pleased a high number of users because it was roomy at the toe box but was snug at the heel
A lot of consumers found the trainer to be stylish and it looked great when paired with their casual clothes
Droves of reviewers claimed that this model delivered adequate arch and lateral support
Based on its build and use of quality materials, the footwear was considered reasonably priced by many shoppers
Numerous people liked how lightweight and airy the shoe felt on their feet
The overall soft construction was appreciated by the buyers with foot issues such as bunions and corns
Several testers were ecstatic that this footgear accommodated the use of custom orthotics
cons: According to a lot of folks, the Propet TravelActiv was not true to size and width
it ran long and loose for some while others found it small and narrow
A significant number of critics did not find the footwear comfortable
the insole was flimsy and wearing it for too long caused foot pain
Plenty of wearers wished that the trainer had better arch and lateral support
In spite of its sporty style, multiple persons were not fond of the aesthetics
There were quality issues reported by a minority of purchasers
the webbed eyelets tore off and the seams unraveled with just a few times of use
Several individuals were disappointed with the Styrofoam-like quality of the sole unit
Some commenters complained that the collar was too high and caused blisters at the back of the ankle

customer_reviews.title: I'm trying to show the detail it's the mesh it almost has a Lacey look to the pattern from distance.
customer_reviews.text: love these shoes! since I now have Osteoarthritis of knees I can't wear average women's sneakers. these are amazingly comfy and light. lots of colors and styles I have bought 2pairs I need 2 more!
customer_reviews.author: kamarx

customer_reviews.title: Cute, comfy, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I'm having a harder and harder time (due to foot and ankle issues) finding shoes that are comfortable, lightweight, and not crazy orthopedic looking. These shoes are cute and comfy - hooray! I'll be trying more from this Propet line.
customer_reviews.author: Caren

customer_reviews.title: Fits like a glove!
customer_reviews.text: This shoe fits like a glove. I suffer from bunions and arthritis in my feet. Purchased a 9.5 wide and it is so comfy. The reason I gave it a 4 out of 5 rating is because I think the insert sole could provide a bit more support. I will most likely put an orthotic insert in the shoes if I plan to do a great deal of walking. The shoe is extremely light and stretchy. It will look good with skinny jeans and leggings because it isn't too bulky like some fashion sneakers. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JGM

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from nerve damage in my left foot, due to a herniated cervical disc, and had been walking with a noticeable limp until purchasing these sneakers, which I had to buy because my left foot is so swollen that I can't wear any of my shoes. I made sure to order extra wide to accommodate the swelling, and what a difference! I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine M.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FIT FOR WIDE FEET AND HEEL PAIN!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! Propet seems to be the only brand that works for me these days. I have problems with my heels and arches that make everything hurt by the end of the day--especially my knees. These are truly perfect for my wide feet. Even though they are "sneakers", they look good enough to wear to work in my office.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but didn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for 10 months and was delighted with them at first. They fit well, had good arch support and looked classy. Plus beige is hard to find in walking shoes. I only wear them to the gym and have probably worn them less than 4 dozen times. I noticed the other day one shoe was rubbing a blister on my heel. The inside of the right shoe has split just about where the P logo is. For a name brand this should not have happened. I have a pair of Sketchers I've worn for 3 years without incident.
customer_reviews.author: Abilene

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoe, just add a scond innsole
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on adding a second innersole right on top of the one provided you will find that these shoes are quite comfortable and you will have better arch support. And since they run on the large side there is plenty of room to add the extra innersole and wear socks too. I've used these in an exercise class as well as for every day. They are nice looking and the fabric breathes. The size 12 doesn't look overly huge. If they hold up well I'll buy them in some more colors.
customer_reviews.author: CTinOC

customer_reviews.title: They were to small and the caption says Returns Free ...
customer_reviews.text: They were to small and the caption says Returns Free. Buyer beware I am being charged a Restocking fee of $6.95.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Update on quality issue!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, comfortable, good looking. And I have a WIDE foot, what with genetics and bunions. Love 'em and may get more. UPDATE!! Well, after wearing these several times, I drop down to three stars due to what may be an off-chance quality issue. The laces weave through fabric loops rather than grommets, and one of the loops popped out. I can still wear the shoes, but the lacing on one foot now is cockeyed. Don't know if this will keep happening......
customer_reviews.author: V. Parker

customer_reviews.title: comfy, good looking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 1/2 AA shoe so finding a shoe with these prerequisites is not easy. These fit perfectly. They are lightweight and comfortable for all day wear and they are narrow without squeezing. They have very little insole padding however. The only thing I do not like about most Prope't shoes are the little loops that the laces go through. They do come off leaving nothing to lace your shoestring through. I wear these shoes o the gym and find that they are non-slip.
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy S. Mall

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable, Light as a Feather!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from edema in my feet. This shoe fits perfectly. Plenty of room, no break in period, very comfortable, light as a feather. I prefer these over my Vionic sneakers so much I just purchased another pair. The toe box is wider than the Easy Spirits I just purchased. The shoe did expand with the swelling of the feet but also contrasted back to shape as the swelling went down in my feet. I purchased the C/D Width for the swelling. I would purchase these shoes again even if I did not have the swelling issue, they are that comfortable. You do not even feel them on your feet!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: No support  at all. With the Propet name. You would think  it would have been a better  shoe 🤔😉
customer_reviews.text: I choose this shoe because, I wanted a light weight walking shoe. It is light...has little to no support ,my inner ankles lean inward...there is no support. I don't feel any arch support, these 2 things you need in a walking support shoe....🤔 not there. And the shoes had been USED!!😟 the sole was already somewhat dirty. I paid for NEW SHOES....poor service!!
customer_reviews.author: sandra C

customer_reviews.title: Improper Fit
customer_reviews.text: This shoe was too long and too thick. I need wide shoes do to a tailors bunion and this shoe is made for fat feet. There was too much space between the top of my foot and the tongue of the shoe. Also the color was called Honey and the photo looks tan, this shoe is bright gold, not a color I would wear. This is the 3rd Propet shoe (all different styles) I've purchased and not one of them fit properly. Options for a 2E width are very limited so I kept hoping one of the many different styles of wide Propet shoes would fit, but they haven't.
customer_reviews.author: Mia's Yaya

customer_reviews.title: Propet consistently delivers a great fitting shoe for my extra wide feet
customer_reviews.text: Propet consistently delivers a great fitting shoe for my extra wide feet. I have several styles and have learned that my size varies by style. Sometimes 6.5. Sometimes 7. But I always need the 2E or 4E extra wide. This particular shoe is extremely lightweight. I use it for walking in the neighborhood. The color is very pretty and true to the ad. For exercise walking I need the more traditional athletic style. I only wish they offered Extra Wide in more styles. I can recommend this shoe for casual wear and extreme comfort.
customer_reviews.author: TL in SB

customer_reviews.title: So..So
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy a half size smaller with Propet because they seem to run big. I did that with these and they just fit. The width seems narrower also so I would maybe order the next width. I did wear them all day but found that I had leg/foot cramps later after I removed them for the night. They are comfortable and cute. Good for running around on a weekend but I wouldn't depend on them for too much support.
customer_reviews.author: Carmella S

customer_reviews.title: Key word is fashion
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a lightweight pair of sneakers/casual sport shoes. I have a wide foot which does fit into this shoe primarily because fabric top is stretchy but the toe is not actually a 4E width. There is no curve indicative of a wider toe and virtually no support. It is kind of what I expected for something labelled "fashion" and I will be able to use somewhat for activities that do not involve intense walking-with the addition of a supportive insole. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Ebright

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoe Purchase in Years
customer_reviews.text: I will order another pair of these very comfortable and lightweight shoes. They aren't for extended wear in winter low temperature, as they let a little air in. I have a bunion on one foot, wide feet, and I use custom-made orthotics, which makes finding comfortable shoe a challenge. I ordered the size I normally order and these fit and feel like a dream. Very pleased! Also, for the first time ever, I am able to leave them tied, and still get them on and off!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reduced quality
customer_reviews.text: Product width has been reduced to the point where I can no longer buy them. Same shoe, same size, purchased for a backup is at least 1/4" narrower than current shoes of same size. Too bad. People who have wide feet know that they are going to have to pay more. Just raise prices a couple dollars on extra wide instead of reducing size for your profit. You have lost me as a customer 😕
customer_reviews.author: sandra smith

customer_reviews.title: Not As comfortable as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: As comfortable as I hoped. I bought a 7 1/2, and it just fit... But I decided it was not quite long enough. I returned it for an eight, and then found that the left shoe was rubbing in the toe area where the seam is. I knew that was going to drive me crazy so now I have to return this one as well. I felt there was very little arch support. On the plus side, they are very cute, they look nice on, and they’re really light! I’m sure a lot of people would find them really comfortable. I wish I could have kept them!
customer_reviews.author: ACNorthShore

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes!
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable shoes in have ever worn! Almost feel as if I'm walking barefoot. I have a hard time finding shoes that fit. I end up frustrated and empty handed when leaving most shoe stores. I hesitate to buy shoes online or from catalogs because you just never know how they'll fit. My shoe are usually too long and too tight. And often ugly. And expensive. These are perfect. I only wish the sole was a bit thicker in order to do more walking outside. I will be purchasing more from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: I feel a little like an oddball since I'm only 32 and buying these shoes, but seriously, the best shoes ever. I have short, very wide feet and also they're half a size off from each other. I have tried all the name brand shoes. I'd have to go up 2 sizes just to get a fit that was still uncomfortable, but I could deal with. And almost shoes give me blisters on my heels. Not these. I did get the wide c/d(?) So make sure you're ordering the correct width. Ordering my second pair in a new color right now.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Love Propet shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a wide but you can't tell. Thank you Propet for making fashionable shoes that don't look orthopedic and reveal that my feet look like Donald Duck! This is my 4th pair of Propet shoes. I have the slip on Mary Janes, the boots, and now these and I love them. If you are looking for support, I would add an insole. These don't have much support and are so light. But I put my own in and they work excellent for a 12 hr day in the emergency room! I wish they came in all black, including the sole. Some companies only allow all black shoes at work. Please make this an option!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: I would rate it ZERO if I could
customer_reviews.text: The color and fit were good. After wearing these only 4 times, the tongue on the left shoe has separated more than 3/4 of the way across the bottom and one of the thread-throughs for the laces has detached. These shoes are now TRASH after one month and having been worn only 4 times. :(. Amazon only refunded 80% of the purchase price and kept the tax I paid because it was past the 30-day return window. I feel cheated.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle in PS

customer_reviews.title: Good for hard to fit arthritic feet
customer_reviews.text: Saving for Spring/summer but initial testing in house positive. If you have hard to fit/fast to hurt features such as hammer toes/bunion area problems, you will like the soft material of these shoes. So, no binding/rubbing pain. Ties make for more flexibility. I am at age where I prefer slip on shoes and wish these were also made with that feature--the bungee type entry instead of regular ties. Would encourage a try though.
customer_reviews.author: sage

customer_reviews.title: Like them
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight.. Minimal arch support. I added orthotic insoles right away. (replaced theirs). I think that will make a big difference when I want to wear them for long periods. I usually wear 10.5 W if I can get them. As with so many shoes, no 10.5 W was offered for these. The 11W is a little long, but my feet don't slip around in them. The lacing is through fabric loops with the exception of the hole closest to the ankle. The metal grommet on the underside of one those loops is unattached and slides along the lace. This leaves me slightly disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: On the Way

customer_reviews.title: Great for a hard-to-fit foot!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an 8 X-wide in gray. I wanted a shoe that was comfortable with socks and I often have trouble with the toe box being too tight. These are fine, but after wearing them for an afternoon, I tried them with the removable shoe liner removed -- and that made them perfect. I think they are very nice looking, and am contemplating buying another pair in a different color now that I know I'm getting a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte M

customer_reviews.title: I can walk in this shoe for hours, without have too much pain.
customer_reviews.text: it is a very comfortable shoe for my very painful feet. It is soft, but still gives support, which I also need. At first I was a little concerned because it only comes in narrow and wide. Wide is usually too large for me, but this shoe fits very well, not too wide at all. I have not yet tried to go for a walk with this shoe, but I might eventually try it out. Going for walks, is rather painful for me.
customer_reviews.author: gamelover

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, comfortable, stylish
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight. Looks attractive on larger feet. I had a tan/gold pair I loved and was excited it was also in dark navy. My foot is on the narrow side and they fit fine with the laces. I have gotten many compliments on these shoes. I washed the gold pair and they still look like new. They are great for shorter walks—a mile or two.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just Ordered My Second Pair
customer_reviews.text: These are easily the most comfortable shoes I’ve ever owned for my poor little 4E wide feet. I even wear them on my days off at home! I have never had shoes that made my feet more comfortable when ON rather than off. I ordered a second pair today as backup because I know how hard it is to find just the right shoes. They wash beautifully, dry quickly, and they BREATHE! No more leather or vinyl shoes for me! Propet, PLEASE keep making these wonderful shoes! I own a pair in a different style and they’re equally fabulous. Thank you for catering to those of us ‘blessed’ with wide feet!
customer_reviews.author: Bibliocat

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, runs narrow.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this brand after owning a different style. I order these in the same size and they were quite narrow. I exchanged them for a wide and the toe box is still a little narrow. I have never needed a wide width before. I still love the shoe and they are super light and comfy. I have no problem fitting my custom orthotics after removing the manufacturer’s insole. I will end up with another pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Jferr

customer_reviews.title: May run small and be a tad wide for a narrow.
customer_reviews.text: The bed of the shoe is actually very comfortable. I’m a size 7 in most shoes, but this one runs a little small for me and my big toe hits the front. For a narrow, it’s actually pretty loose. I have narrow feet, but they aren’t extremely narrow. I had to tighten the shoe pretty tight to fit my feet snug. I ended up returning them due to the size, but they are pretty and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: L. R.

customer_reviews.title: True to fit. I love them.
customer_reviews.text: I like the look and feel of them, love the mesh upper, comfortable removable insoles and the size is true. However, if you have to wear custom insoles like me, I would go up a size to allow more room in the toe area so I am returning these ten B for 11 B to see if that helps . I have found another style by Propet that I didn't see before that I'm going to try first before reordering these that I also like.
customer_reviews.author: Fish Lover

customer_reviews.title: 4E narrower than expected
customer_reviews.text: I wear 4E in women's New Balance sneakers due to bunions, and I was hoping these would be a less athletic-looking shoe that would still be side enough for me. Not even close. The 4E shoes fit like 2E shoes from most manufacturers. Too narrow. I returned these and will continue searching. It's a shame, because the shoes were feather-light and I really liked them otherwise. My search continues.
customer_reviews.author: Feline

customer_reviews.title: 3rd time is the charm!
customer_reviews.text: These were the third Prophet sneakers I’d purchased. The first two were slip-ons. I guess my feet are constructed for slip-ons. I persevered because of the great reviews. The lace-ups did the trick. Love the look. So very comfy. Seem to be well made. If they wear well, I’ll be ordering more. I deducted one star because, like others noted, I had to add orthopedic insoles.
customer_reviews.author: b

customer_reviews.title: One of the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn
customer_reviews.text: One of the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn. They are really light in weight and are not real hot like leather top sneakers. I don't know how long they will last, however, where I purchased one in every color I won't be wearing them every day and maybe they won't wear out as fast. The sizing advertised was my exact size. Not to small or large. I was not looking for a total foot support because these don't have it. Just a comfortable walking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Here I am again

customer_reviews.title: Cute shoe
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shoe because of the removable footbed. I wanted to use my custom orthotic. Ordinarily I wear a medium width shoe but because I wanted to use my own orthotic I ordered the wide. Even with the orthotic, I believe a medium would have worked. The shoe is really cute and I wanted something that was not as clunky as athletic shoes. Unfortunately, this shoe turned out to be too flat for comfort. I need a heel wth more lift.
customer_reviews.author: gigi

customer_reviews.title: So light and comfy! and attractive too :)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes to wear with my new specialized orthotics. I have been using them to walk in ever since and have had no foot pain. No break-in required... they felt wonderful right from the start. And the "goldish" color is lovely - it goes with most anything. Paired with the "lace-like" detail, it is a very fashionable shoe. I've already had so many compliments!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy G

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically buy a wide shoe but I decided to because I'm planning on doing a bunch of walking on my vacation and needed to be able to wear socks. If these are wide, I'd hate to think how a regular width would feel. The toe box was extremely tight. There was absolutely no support, like walking on concrete. Each shoe only weighs several ounces. I just don't understand how the reviews could be so good, unless they are all fudged or this is a cheap knockoff. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: J.H.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for very sensitive problem feet.
customer_reviews.text: These are the 1st gym shoe I have been able to wear in many years. My feet and toes are extremely sensitive and these shoe don't apply pressure when lacing them up. They breath and are light weight and I now own 3 pair. I generally wear a 7W but in these I am wearing a 8WW. They only lack support so I bought a pair of cushioned arch support insoles to replace the ones they came with and problem solved. I highly recommend them especially if you have very sensitive problem feet. Oh, and they are a very pretty shoe that looks lacy and feminine.
customer_reviews.author: DJ's Bike

customer_reviews.title: foot bed uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Liked the fit but not the feel of these shoes. I thought they fit fine at first but after walking on them my arch started hurting and the bottom of my feet hurt. I tried a different insert but realized the opening of the shoe felt flimsy and was afraid it would not hold up to daily wear. Seems the lighter shoes are too flimsy for my taste. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: amazonuser

customer_reviews.title: Fashion Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: The little shoe fits well and that it is black was the ticket item for me. The material on the shoe is material and stretches so it works with one bunion. I have to be careful, but in this shoe it is all go!! I also have a pair in red - love, love, love
customer_reviews.author: Arkansas ladyl

customer_reviews.title: Laces are way too long!
customer_reviews.text: There are some good things about these shoes and some not so good. Cons: -Shoe laces way too long and keep coming untied creating a fall hazard. -Not enough support for long walks. Pros: -I have large bunions and a hammer toe and the soft sides and extra wide sizes make these shoes nice to walk in. The fabric sides, although not providing sufficient foot support, do make them comfortable. -Good for shorter walks of about 2 miles or less. -My 3/4 orthotics fit well into the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not stretchy
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 7.5 extra-extra-wide and couldn't get my foot inside the shoe. My photo compares this 4X wide shoe to my usual New Balance 840 in a single-wide width. The fabric does not stretch any more than regular fabric. The toe box is narrow. I have very large, painful bunions on both feet. This style does not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with sensitive feet
customer_reviews.text: I liked them, they’re cute, but as soon as I put them on they were very hard, not comfortable at all. The arch support was closer to my heel than the middle of my foot. The heel is a little narrow for my liking considering I have bad heel pain after a while of being on my feet. I wore them around the house for a bit, but they were very uncomfortable. These extra wide width would have been Perfect if they had memory foam or some sort of spongy sole both inside and Out. Would not recommend for anyone with foot problems. The price is not worth buying, it’s a poorly made shoe.
customer_reviews.author: MGast

customer_reviews.title: They feel GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: After years of searching, I finally found a brand of shoes that is what it says it is!!! They are stylish and extremely comfortable, even for my arthritic feet. The are plenty wide which is wonderful, because there is no added pressure to set off my fibromyalgia. Thank you for a wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT COMFORT
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to write a review till these were walked in for a while. I have sever feet problems. These are amazing for the price. I put my special insert inside. They are not tight and no unusual seams. Plus can wash. I ordered another pair. Considering the price of orthopedic shoes these are a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Damiano

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I have multiple dislocated toes and a wide foot to start with so finding these in EE is like finding treasure. This is my 5th pair of Propets ( I rotate them) and i have been buying a pair whenever they are in stock and on sale in my size. I have found that either Dr. Scholl's arch inserts of blue Super feet allow me to walk as far and as long as I want in these.
customer_reviews.author: Bette Spagel

customer_reviews.title: The wide is very true to size.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoes. True width, lightweight, very comfortable,my feet were not killing me after shopping. I have severe neuropathy. Recommend these shoes to everyone with pain and swelling. I also have lymphodemia in legs and feet so I know what I'm talking about with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Jones

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! They are so light and comfortable! I wear them with a Motion Control Insoles which provide more cushioning as well as more stability, given that I need both. The combination is perfect for me! The mesh on these shoes makes them so breathable and cool. Despite the fact that I wear a size 11 W, they don't look clunky or huge. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Book lover in Leeds

customer_reviews.title: Everyday sneaker
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely comfortable. I previously purchased the slip on version because I liked the aesthetic better but when they ripped on the side (after over a year) like all of my other sneakers do that aren’t wide width, I decided to take a chance on these. They are the best sneaker I’ve owned. They aren’t built to last forever but you definitely get your money’s worth, especially if you buy the right size. They are very very breathable, so not ideal for colder weather or your feet will freeze but they are perfect for summer and most of fall.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The shoe fits okay.....the toe box is not nearly as wide as I had hoped it would be but everything else is a good width. It's too late to send them back or I would so I could find another pair with a toe box width to match the rest of the shoe. When I wear them, I kind of feel like I have on "old lady shoes"; they're don't exude the cool image I want to convey.
customer_reviews.author: blessedbeyondwords

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfying comfort shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shoe to protect in comfort, and I got just that in these Propet shoes. These are comfy. These are easing up the pain and throbbing I was having with my New Balance.... don't get me wrong about NB. It's that when I sit for long periods of time I was placing my feet in various positions that caused pain later resulting in foot throbs throughout the night, resulting in lack of sleep. These have really helped me out. I would love to know how they handle on ice and snow???
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried because a 9.5 in some shoes runs small but these are perfect. I purchased wide because I have a very high arch and this shoes fit perfect and the appearance is lovely. It's difficult to buy a tennis shoe that doesn't appear heavy or load in appearance. I was looking for a shoe that I could wear all day at work with my Capri pants and these are perfect. The shoe is light weight and has good support I'm look forward to buying more shoes from Propet.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Magill

customer_reviews.title: AFO Friendly!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a partial paralysis in my right foot and as a result wear a brace. I found these particular propet shoes very AFO Friendly. I order 1 size up and 2E (double wide) because of the width of my AFO. Great great shoes, I have them in honey and black.
customer_reviews.author: Salsa2021

customer_reviews.title: I am thrilled with this shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled with this shoe. I have many foot problems, mainly bunion and hammer toes. It is very difficult to get shoes that I can wear without a lot of pain. This shoe is perfect for my feet. The somewhat stretchy top of the shoe over my toes accommodates my hammer toes with zero discomfort. I have already bought 4 pair and will probably buy more. It is a nice extra benefit that they are moderately priced and I have even found some for about half price on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: cute but the fit is 'way too small
customer_reviews.text: These are really cute shoes with a lace-like pattern, and are lightweight. However they run very small - I normally get a 2E (2 extra wide) and I couldn't even get my foot all the way in these even with that width, partially because of a seam that runs across the lower instep. If you need a lot of support these probably wouldn't work either. Had to send them back. It's too bad, they're pretty for sneakers.
customer_reviews.author: loomweaver

customer_reviews.title: Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an extra wide because I recently got custom orthotics. No way are these extra wide shoes. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: KarmaGuard

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and comfortable walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I bought my 1st pair, then bought a 2nd for when these wear out, and then bought a pair as a gift for mom for Christmas! I do love Propet for walking shoes, have had a few pairs over the years and liked each one. I pretty much got what I expected and I'm very happy with them. Also have Propet winter boots and love those too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight. Comfortable. Good support
customer_reviews.text: I have bunions and hammertoes and have a difficult time finding shoes that don't cause discomfort. These offer decent support and are lightweight and extremely comfortable even after 10 plus hours. They can be laundered in the washer and did not shrink in the dryer. And they don't look like "foot problem" shoes. I'll be buying a lot more pairs!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Ringen

customer_reviews.title: Propet Women's Travelactiv Fashion Sneaker -Grey
customer_reviews.text: They fit my wide foot. I ordered wide width and they fit as expected. Comfortable. Propet is a widely acclaimed brand and they should fit. These do. I like the lacey feminine material. Well made and are holding up nicely. I've had mine a year now. I don't wear them constantly, but at least once a week. I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: E. W.

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully fit
customer_reviews.text: This brand has large widths that made my shoe size smaller and fits with style and comfort. Highly recommend I'd on your feet a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Debi McComas

customer_reviews.title: This is my second pair. Purchased grey color in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my Thurs pair. Purchased grey color in April and white prior to thsy. No breaking in period. Thought about ordering a 9 1/2 W but stayed with the 9. If the material had been leather would have gone a 1/2 size bigger. The material has a lot of give so the 9W works for me. If you use an orthodic insert, then order a 1/2 size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: LHJ

customer_reviews.title: As a woman with a larger and wider foot it is so hard for me to find a comfortable and stylist shoe that I would not mind wearing
customer_reviews.text: These were an unexpected and cost friendly game changer. As a woman with a larger and wider foot it is so hard for me to find a comfortable and stylist shoe that I would not mind wearing. I worse these to huge conference where I was walking well over 17,000 steps a day and these made that possible. Additionally, I was able to remove the insert that was included and able to add my own custom inserts for additional comfort. I will be back for more pairs. Oh! And they feel very light - so no sweaty feet! :)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonGiraffeMa

customer_reviews.title: Very Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I purchaed the silver color for summer. It goes nice with my wardrobe. I use prescription orthotics so they are easy to slip in these shoes. I wear 10 narrow and these shoes are the perfect fit. I also have a pair in black for early spring and fall. They are very comfortable and fit very well.
customer_reviews.author: Knitter

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Comfy
customer_reviews.text: So happy with my purchase. These sneakers are lightweight and breathable, but provide plenty of arch support and comfort. I've had problem with heel pain with other brands but no pain wearing these all day. I wore them everyday on vacation, averaging 15,000 steps each day, with no discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cerutti

customer_reviews.title: If you want comfort, this is the sneaker for you!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of Propet sneakers. I have 2 pair and I bought 2 pairs for my mother. They are light-weight, almost like wearing slippers. They have an open weave top so your feet can breathe. I cannot recommend these enough!
customer_reviews.author: Doreen R

customer_reviews.title: Good for Diabetics
customer_reviews.text: My mom has diabetes and her feet are very sensitive. We bought these shoes specifically because of the mesh fabric. Shoes specifically for diabetics are very expensive, so I was looking for other options. So far it's working out great! She says they are very comfortable and they don't cause her the same discomfort as traditional shoes. She is planning to try some of the other shoes made by this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Candace S.

customer_reviews.title: Best summer walking shoe - ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. I bought the first pair three summers ago and I loved them ! They clean up splendidly, and are so amazingly comfortable. I can walk for hours and stand even longer without my feet screaming at me at the end of the day. They are light on the foot, but sturdy while walking on all types of terrain. No they are not made for hiking, but from rocky surfaces to grass they provide comfort and stability like no other.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Sears

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten this shoe in white and have worn it for a few years. Still comfortable and going strong. Ordered it in black, and it just arrived. Nice fit. I liked that they have extra-wide to accommodate my sometimes thick socks. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Patty Apostolides (Author)

customer_reviews.title: Great casual shoe
customer_reviews.text: I can walk in them all day -- but, they are not for hiking; for that, I wear a heavier shoe with a better arch support. For city life in and out of the car, shopping, 'gadding' about town they are perfect. Lightweight and fashionable, I am very pleased with this shoe and have purchased two pair (different colors). The arch support is adequate, sort of neutral -- a classmate of mine has a high arch and I have flat feet but the shoe works for us both.
customer_reviews.author: S. Soloff

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, would buy again
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight and dependable. I ordered my regular size, 10 wide, and the fit is perfect. I have gotten many compliments. The detailing provides a nice design rather than just being plain. They do get dirty because they are light gray, but easy to clean. One issue that is not a deal breaker, when it rains my feet get wet.
customer_reviews.author: KJules

customer_reviews.title: GOOD SHOES !
customer_reviews.text: I AM VERY VERY HARD TO FIT FOR FOR SHOES . I HAD SURGERY ON ONE KNEE WHICH LEFT THAT FOOT SWOLLEN AND SO I NEED A VERY WIDE SHOE . I ORDERED THE 4 E AND I LOVE THESE SHOES . I MIGHT ORDER ANOTHER PAIR IF THEY EVER GO ON SALE . IF U THINKING ABOUT ORDERING THEM YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY . I AM 64 AND THESE SHOES MAKE ME FEEL LIKE I AM WALKING ON AIR. VERY GOOD FIT AND BOUNCE. I JUST WISH THEY HAD A LITTLE MORE SUPPORT IN THE SOLE . ONLY DOWN FALL . THE SOLE IS FLIMSY !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wide Width For Bunion Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I have horrible bunions and was looking for a substantial shoe that could accommodate my foot issues. These Propet brand are wonderful!! The soft shoe allows for bunion comfort and I added a new insole for my flat feet. You wouldn’t need to do that if your feet are normal. The wide width is a blessing and my feet are very happy!!
customer_reviews.author: suz

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable sneaker for achy feet...
customer_reviews.text: I have psoriatic arthritis that effects my size 11 wide feet. These are the most comfortable shoes I have ever worn! They are light as a feather and you can see they are very well made. There is sufficient arch support too. I honestly did not have to "break" them in at all and have been wearing them daily since they arrived. I will continue to purchase my shoes from Propet from now on. I am more than happy with the Propet Women's Travelactiv Fashion Sneaker. I would highly recommend buying this shoe for the comfort factor alone.
customer_reviews.author: Sari

customer_reviews.title: Tongue coming out of shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look and feel of these shoes, but after wearing them only three times, the tongue on the right shoe is coming out of the shoe! you can see the white stitching that was supposed to hold the black tongue in the black shoe. I'm so disappointed! I was really excited to get these shoes and they are very comfortable. I know they run wide, so I got a regular width and they fit perfectly. But what's up with the quality of the workmanship??
customer_reviews.author: Becky Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have always been curious about this brand of shoes and after breaking my ankle and surgery, I was needing a wide shoe to fit the ankle brace I have to wear. I saw these and decided to try them instead of paying around $150.00 forthe brand physical therapist and orthopedic surgical Dr was recommending. I really am happy with these shoes. They are lightweight, and comfortable, and was well.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Spain

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and cute
customer_reviews.text: These are super cute shoes. I’ll be getting more colors for sure. They are very lightweight with descent support. They were comfortable right out of the box and great for all day wear. Accommodating to my swelling feet. Never felt to tight
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly designed shoe.
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect shoe. I love it...my fourth pair. One in white, silver, navy and black. The most comfortable and pleasing looking tennis shoe I have ever owned. The lacy look makes them perfect to wear with dressy pants. I am left with knee discomfort and balance problems after an accident which crushed my kneecap. As a result, I just cannot wear many of my dress shoes, especially those with heels over 1 inch. When I wear these shoes with a dressy pant suit, I feel like my shoes compliment my outfit. Thank you Propet' for this perfectly designed shoe.
customer_reviews.author: W Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable, thick sole adds good support, normally wear 9w or 9ww, ordered a 9.5 2e (extra wide) I am happy with the room for my toes with out socks, and there is plenty of room to wear socks for a tighter fit. Love them, like walking on cushions. Shoes have round tips so toes are not squished. I'm going to order another pair, Never had such a comfortable sneaker due to my wide feet. They look nice too! Also extremely light weight. If you have hard to fit wide feet, these are a must have!!
customer_reviews.author: LRS

customer_reviews.title: Love these- comfy, light, washing machine friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Love these so much!! Fun to wear. So comfy I forget what I am wearing until someone compliments them! Which happens every time I wear them. I got the raspberry colored ones which technically don’t “go with” anything but they make the outfit!
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of these I have ordered and worn. People have stopped me and asked where I got them. I had to do a lot of physical therapy and wore them everyday. The reason I had to replace them was the extreme wear in the heel area on one of the shoes. I love to wear them but Now and then I have to wear a dressier shoe. Bleah
customer_reviews.author: Marian the Librarian

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I needed wide sneakers because I have to use an orthotic brace to fit in the shoe. These did the trick. They have NO weight at all to them and I don’t know what the sole is made of but it flexes where it needs to flex. The upper part is not stiff and conforms to my leg braces as I need them
customer_reviews.author: kmg

customer_reviews.title: Love my new Propet Sneakers
customer_reviews.text: I have a difficult time finding shoes that feel good enough to wear for very long, due to a bad back and I stand most of the day and evening. Love these shoes they feel good, light and don't hurt my feet. Im so happy that I took a chance and ordered them online. I wear a size 7, and got them in a 7 medium they fit great. And look beautiful. Happy, happy :)
customer_reviews.author: Dian B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and lightweight orthotic
customer_reviews.text: I am completely pleased with this shoe. I need orthotic shoes and I am always skeptic about buying a new brand not knowing how they would fit. I love these. They are light, do not keep my feet hot and I wear them all day. I used them to walk around Disneyland the first week expecting them to hurt my feet by the end of the day. What a great way to test them out. I will be buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: rottielove

customer_reviews.title: Pretty, Light, & Airy Sneaker in Wide
customer_reviews.text: I have had many compliments on these! I love the lacy perforations on top and the soft, flexible sole. Lighter and cooler than any sneaker I know of. Gold color turned out to be a good way to dress up jeans and khakis. I need a C-width or wider, and Propet's fit was perfect. Wish I had this shoe in every color!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Ohio

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FIT, COMFORTABILITY, BEAUTIFUL
customer_reviews.text: I bought 10N although I am a AAA. It fit well with the extra help of one higher place near the ankle to adjust further. Light, extremely supportive for me, beautiful. Love them! Never used this brand before. I am sold forever.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Carol

customer_reviews.title: Propet Women's Travelactive Fashion Sneaker
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes on 10/3/16. I wear them once or twice a week. Last week, 12/8/16, a tab for the laces came out. I consider that to be poor workmanship. I really like the shoes but I cannot be sewing them back together every couple of times I wear them. Think twice about purchasing these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Pabs

customer_reviews.title: I was happy when I found a narrow width in my size
customer_reviews.text: I was happy when I found a narrow width in my size. They are comfortable with one small exception. They are a little shorter than medium width shoes. Next time I will order the next 1/2 up. I also have gotten many compliments on the look of the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: As comfortable as slippers!
customer_reviews.text: I have problems buying shoes. My feet are long and narrow. I need shoes that accommodate my orthotics, which these do. While I usually wear athletic shoes for the support they provide, these shoes give me an alternative for occasions and clothes that require a slightly dressier look. I bought two pair and I'm glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: BEST SHOES EVER
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th pair of these shoes. I'm old, my toes are crippled and these are the only shoes I can wear that give my toes room. They are ultra comfortable!! My orthotics fit well. It's like walking in bedroom slippers. I've had 2 pairs for 2 years. They really hold up well. I love them - can't wait to buy more!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jillebean

customer_reviews.title: The Most Comfortable Shoes Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't bought workout shoes in forever. I hate paying $100 or more for them- crazy! These are reasonably priced- $48! They are the most comfortable shoes I've ever bought. They even come in narrow which is unheard of! I plan to reorder in another color.
customer_reviews.author: Harriet

customer_reviews.title: Cloth, stretches to fit 4E, comfortable & casual cute.
customer_reviews.text: Fit as hoped! Impossible to find ladies' footwear for 4E feet except by Propet and Drew. These are cloth sides that stretch to accommodate width. I have chronic edema so I wear shoes with more support most of the time. These are cute enough& lightweight, acceptable worn with a casual skirt.
customer_reviews.author: Occa

customer_reviews.title: Good walkers. All day comfort.
customer_reviews.text: These are such comfortable shoes. I bought wide because I had foot surgery about a year ago and like my shoes a bit looser. They are wide enough for me but I can see how they might not be wide enough for some people. The fit is similar to relaxed fit in Sketchers brand. Insoles are comfortable and can be removed and replaced. I like these so much that I bought a second pair. Also own 2 pairs in different styles.
customer_reviews.author: Didi

customer_reviews.title: but they seem like they will work well
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to wear them for long periods of time, but they seem like they will work well. The fit was true to size. The color and design are as pictured. The shoe is incredibly lightweight. I hope to put in some insoles, but the ones that came with it seem supportive as well. And the best part is that they aren't super expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Cassinopeeva

customer_reviews.title: Ugly color
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were an ugly color of dark, olive/brown. No where near the tan that was pictured. I had to return them, however, they were very lightweight and comfortable after adding insoles and arch supports.
customer_reviews.author: Pat N

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoes but runs small
customer_reviews.text: These shoes look really nice but seem to run small. I ordered an 8 1/2 wide, which is what I always wear. These shoes were shorter and more narrow than the 8 1/2 wides I get from other companies. I think a 1/2 size bigger might be a better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: I have really wide feet and sometimes wide width are just not wide enough. I ordered these in an 8.5 ww and they are perfect. I can actually wear socks with them and still have wiggle room. They are cute too. The insert comes out and is not stiched in, so I can replace them with my orthodic insoles. Think I am gonna like these a lot. May order them in another color.
customer_reviews.author: dean rogstad

customer_reviews.title: No more squished toes!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my gf who is on her feet most of the day and has an issue with her pinky toe feeling squished in other brand of shoes. She loves these and have had several compliments on them. She doesn't have the feel of her toes being squished either. Good quality shoe and look super cute on!
customer_reviews.author: Dwomyn

customer_reviews.title: Good with Orthotics
customer_reviews.text: I need to have room for orthotics now. Ordered a half size larger and orthotics fit well. These don't rise as high up as regular sneakers and thus do not cut off the ankle bone as much. Not a lot of support, but good with the orthotic and flexible. I don't like the aging foot issues, but at least I have found some reasonably priced shoes to make me more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MomM

customer_reviews.title: Great for AFO foot brace.
customer_reviews.text: Love this sneaker. I had to buy two pairs (different sizes) since I had to size up for one foot to fit an AFO leg brace in them. Fits perfectly and are extremely comfortable. It has a lot of give to it. Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

product_meta.title: Propet Women's TravelActiv Fashion Sneaker
product_meta.description: The TravelActiv walking shoe from Prop�t provides breathable, unique style with its stretch fabric mesh upper, while the padded tongue and collar enhance fit and comfort.
feature_bullets: Lace-up sneaker featuring lightweight flexible outsole and removable footbed
